sentence.Network_en: The MOD gave an undertaking to Saville that it had provided him with all relevant material.

sentence.Network_en: The house is spacious with all mod cons, handy for the station and has a garden.
sentence.Network_cn: 这座房子十分宽敞，现代化生活设施一应俱全，距离车站很近，而且还有一个花园。

sentence.Network_en: Then he read the instructions: Bake in mod. oven for one hour.
sentence.Network_cn: 再看看说明: “温炉内烤一小时. ”

entry.tran: 摩登派(常指英国20世纪60年代初穿着时髦整洁、骑小轮摩托车并喜欢灵乐的青少年)
entry.def: Mods are young people in Britain who wear a special kind of neat clothes, ride motor scooters, and like soul music. Many young people were mods in the early 1960s.

means.word_mean: 1. a British teenager or young adult in the 1960s; noted for their clothes consciousness and opposition to the rockers
1. relating to a recently developed fashion or style;

sentences.sentence: "their offices are in a modern skyscraper"
